alert.note: Alert for Southern El Paso County Including Fort Carson and Colorado Springs (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 11 at 4:01AM MDT until April 11 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning remains in effect from Noon until 8 PM MDT Today for for gusty winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 224, and zones 226 through 237, which includes all of the eastern plains of southeast Colorado, Fremont county and the San Luis valley (NOTE that the San Luis Valley, Northern El Paso county, and Fremont county have been added to this warning... ...Red Flag Warning has been issued from 11 AM TO 8 PM Tuesday for gusty winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 226 through 237 which includes all of the eastern plains of southeast Colorado... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 227... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 227... The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM to 8 PM MDT Tuesday. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 227. * Winds...Winds...For TODAY: South to southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 45 mph. For TOMORROW: Southwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * Timing...Noon until 8 PM MDT Monday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 13 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Southern El Paso County Including Fort Carson and Colorado Springs
